intro: Scelochilus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable-leaved scelochilus, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its diverse leaf morphology, which can vary significantly between individuals. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. The species is of interest to botanists due to its adaptive leaf structures and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
